newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold easier, turnover off sharply.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold easier, turnover off sharply.

text.p: Istanbul gold exchange volume dipped to 802 kilos on Thursday from Wednesday's 1,373 amid uncertainty over market direction, dealers said.
Gold closed slightly easier at $327.50 an ounce and 1,721,000 lira per gram, versus $328.00 and 1,725,900 lira at Wednesday's close.

"Most of the trade still consists of physical demand coming from outside Istanbul to the free market. But there are also some traders taking up positions on gold expecting it to test the $330 level," one dealer said.
Turkish banks' dollar bids firmed to 163,250-300 lira against the interbank close of 163,390 on Wednesday. No dollar deals were made on the interbank.
Most of the day's gold trade -- 672 kg -- was in the morning session, with 89.4 percent of the total in lira terms.
